speaker: WILLIAMS
text: I warrant it is to knight you, captain.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: God’s will and His pleasure,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: captain, I beseech you now, come apace to the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: King. There is more good toward you peradventure

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: than is in your knowledge to dream of.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Sir, know you this glove?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Know the glove? I know the glove is a glove.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: I know this, and thus I challenge it.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: ’Sblood, an arrant traitor as any ’s in the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: universal world, or in France, or in England!

speaker: GOWER
text: How now, sir? You villain!

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Do you think I’ll be forsworn?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Stand away, Captain Gower. I will give treason

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: his payment into plows, I warrant you.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: I am no traitor.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: That’s a lie in thy throat.—I charge you in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: his Majesty’s name, apprehend him. He’s a friend

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: of the Duke Alençon’s.

speaker: WARWICK
text: How now, how now, what’s the matter?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: My Lord of Warwick, here is, praised be

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: God for it, a most contagious treason come to

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: light, look you, as you shall desire in a summer’s

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: day.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Here is his Majesty.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: How now, what’s the matter?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: My liege, here is a villain and a traitor, that,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: look your Grace, has struck the glove which your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Majesty is take out of the helmet of Alençon.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: My liege, this was my glove; here is the fellow

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: of it. And he that I gave it to in change promised to

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: wear it in his cap. I promised to strike him if he did.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: I met this man with my glove in his cap, and I have

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: been as good as my word.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Your Majesty, hear now, saving your Majesty’s

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: manhood, what an arrant, rascally, beggarly,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: lousy knave it is. I hope your Majesty is pear me

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: testimony and witness and will avouchment that

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: this is the glove of Alençon that your Majesty is give

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: me, in your conscience now.

              HENRY

              HENRY
text: Look, here is the fellow of it.

              HENRY
text:

              most

KING
               
              HENRY
text: How canst thou make me

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: satisfaction?

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: All offenses, my lord, come from the heart.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Never came any from mine that might offend your

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Majesty.

KING
               
              HENRY
text: It was ourself thou didst abuse.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Your Majesty came not like yourself. You

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: appeared to me but as a common man; witness the

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: night, your garments, your lowliness. And what

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: your Highness suffered under that shape, I beseech

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: you take it for your own fault and not mine, for, had

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: you been as I took you for, I made no offense.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Therefore, I beseech your Highness pardon me.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: good. ’Tis a good silling, I warrant you, or I will
